content.description: Small crack with very old but solid looking piton near the top. Awkward topout.
content.protection: Small cams and nuts. A #2 did help from preventing a ground fall off the start.

content.description: Crux is at the bottom. Beware of poor rock quality in the crack, especially if you are climbing this as a trad climb. Big jugs as you get higher up.
content.protection: Only placed two pieces on gear (#2 and big nut), but a #4 would have been nice. A pad could be helpful if you are doing this as a boulder, but won't do you much good higher up.
content.location: The obvious crack on the front side when you first approach the tower.

content.description: Good crack that widens as it goes up.

A short 25-foot split tower boasts three pretty easy trad climbs. The real crux here is avoiding the choss, since the whole rock is pretty grainy and the placements aren't very bomber.   Definitely bring some cordelette to rap/lower off the 2 rusty bolts on top. The spacing of these two bolts gives an incredibly strong rope drag for all of the climbs on this tower.   No info on the chopped bolt line on the right side of the spire, but would be greatly appreciated if anyone knows anything about it.
